parameters.description: The ID of the group.

parameters.description: The ID of the resource that is shared.

parameters.description: ID of target user

put.summary: Transfer ownership of this object to another user

parameters.description: The ID of the resource that is shared.

get.summary: List Aliases

parameters.name: object_type
parameters.description: Filter results by object type. Pass multiple object types with a comma-separatedlist. Valid types include: cass_ncoa, container_script, geocode, identity_resolution, dbt_script, python_script, r_script, javascript_script, sql_script, project, notebook, workflow, template_script, template_report, service, report, tableau and service_report.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 50. Maximum allowed is 1000.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to id. Must be one of: id, object_type.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to asc.

get.summary: Get an Alias

put.summary: Replace all attributes of this Alias

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the Alias object.

patch.summary: Update some attributes of this Alias

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the Alias object.

delete.summary: Delete an alias

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The id of the Alias object.

get.summary: Get details about an alias within an FCO type

parameters.name: object_type
parameters.description: The type of the object. Valid types include: cass_ncoa, container_script, geocode, identity_resolution, dbt_script, python_script, r_script, javascript_script, sql_script, project, notebook, workflow, template_script, template_report, service, report, tableau and service_report.

parameters.name: alias
parameters.description: The alias of the object

get.summary: List announcements

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 10. Maximum allowed is 50.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to released_at. Must be one of: released_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

get.summary: List Kubernetes Clusters

parameters.name: organization_id
parameters.description: The ID of this cluster's organization. Cannot be used along with the organization slug.

parameters.name: organization_slug
parameters.description: The slug of this cluster's organization. Cannot be used along with the organization ID.

parameters.name: raw_cluster_slug
parameters.description: The slug of this cluster's raw configuration.

parameters.name: exclude_inactive_orgs
parameters.description: When true, excludes KubeClusters associated with inactive orgs. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to its maximum of 50.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to organization_id. Must be one of: organization_id, created_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to asc.

get.summary: Get list of Credential Types
List credentials

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type (or types) of credentials to return. One or more of: Amazon Web Services S3, Bitbucket, CASS/NCOA PAF, Certificate, Civis Platform, Custom, Database, Google, Github, Salesforce User, Salesforce Client, and TableauUser. Specify multiple values as a comma-separated list (e.g., "A,B").

parameters.name: remote_host_id
parameters.description: The ID of the remote host associated with the credentials to return.

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: If true, will return a list with a single credential which is the current user's default credential.

parameters.name: system_credentials
parameters.description: If true, will only return system credentials. System credentials can only be created and viewed by Civis Admins.

parameters.name: users
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of user ids. If specified, returns set of credentials owned by the users that requesting user has at least read access on.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: If specified, will be used to filter the credentials returned. Will search across name and will return any full name containing the search string.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to its maximum of 1000.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to updated_at. Must be one of: updated_at, created_at, name.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

One or more of: Amazon Web Services S3, Bitbucket, CASS/NCOA PAF, Certificate, Civis Platform, Custom, Database, Google, Github, Salesforce User, Salesforce Client, and TableauUser. Specify multiple values as a comma-separated list (e.g., "A,B").

parameters.name: remoteHostId
parameters.description: The ID of the remote host associated with the credentials to return.

parameters.name: default
parameters.description: If true, will return a list with a single credential which is the current user's default credential.

parameters.name: systemCredentials
parameters.description: If true, will only return system credentials. System credentials can only be created and viewed by Civis Admins.

parameters.name: users
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of user ids. If specified, returns set of credentials owned by the users that requesting user has at least read access on.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: If specified, will be used to filter the credentials returned. Will search across name and will return any full name containing the search string.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to its maximum of 1000.

parameters.name: pageNum
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to updated_at. Must be one of: updated_at, created_at, name.

parameters.name: orderDir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

x-examples.description: Scan an entire schema in a database

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the database.

parameters.name: schema
parameters.description: The name of the schema.

parameters.name: statsPriority
parameters.description: When to sync table statistics for every table in the schema. Valid options are the following. Option: 'flag' means to flag stats for the next scheduled run of a full table scan on the database. Option: 'block' means to block this job on stats syncing. Option: 'queue' means to queue a separate job for syncing stats and do not block this job on the queued job. Defaults to 'flag'

parameters.description: If specified, return items of these types.

parameters.description: If specified, return items from any of these authors. It accepts a comma-separated list of user IDs.

parameters.description: If specified, returns items with one of these statuses. It accepts a comma-separated list, possible values are 'running', 'failed', 'succeeded', 'idle', 'scheduled'.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: The archival status of the requested item(s).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 20. Maximum allowed is 50.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to updated_at. Must be one of: updated_at, name, created_at, last_run.updated_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

post.description: Imports have a variety of types and consist of one or more syncs. Once you've created your import, use the post syncs endpoint to create new syncs for it. Make sure to set attributes which are compatible with the type of import you're using, either Dbsync, AutoImport, GdocImport or GdocExport.

post.summary: Initate an import of a tabular file into the platform
post.description:
Importing a tabular file, such as a CSV, begins with this endpoint. 
Compatible files must be comma, tab, or pipe-delimited. 
They may be uncompressed, gzipped or zipped if the archive contains a single file. 

This endpoint returns two URIs which must be used to complete the import. 
The `uploadUri` is used to upload the file you wish to import. By default it expects the file contents 
in the body of a PUT request. Some examples of this usage are:

* Python requests:

    ```
    requests.put(<uploadUri>, data=open('<file_name>', 'rb'))
    ```
* curl:

    ```
    curl --request PUT --upload-file <file_name> <uploadUri>
    ```

If you set `multipart: true`, `uploadUri` will expect a `multipart/form-data` POST request 
including the attached `uploadFields` plus a `file` field (in this order):

* Browser (AJAX form submission):

    ```
    var data = new FormData();
    _.each(<uploadFields>, (value, field) => data.append(field, value));
    data.append("file", fileInput.files[0]);
    request.post(<uploadUri>, { body: data });
    ```

Once the upload is complete, the `runUri` field may then be used to 
complete the import of the uploaded tabular file.

get.summary: List Jobs

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The job's state. One or more of queued, running, succeeded, failed, and cancelled. Specify multiple values as a comma-separated list (e.g., "A,B").

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The job's type. Specify multiple values as a comma-separated list (e.g., "A,B").

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: Query string to search on the id, name, and job type.

parameters.name: permission
parameters.description: A permissions string, one of "read", "write", or "manage". Lists only jobs for which the current user has that permission.

parameters.name: scheduled
parameters.description: If the item is scheduled.

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: If specified to be true, returns hidden items. Defaults to false, returning non-hidden items.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: The archival status of the requested item(s).

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: If specified, return items from any of these authors. It accepts a comma-separated list of user IDs.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to its maximum of 50.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to updated_at. Must be one of: updated_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

get.summary: List

parameters.name: model_name
parameters.description: If specified, will be used to filter the models returned. Substring matching is supported. (e.g., "modelName=model" will return both "model1" and "my model").

parameters.name: training_table_name
parameters.description: If specified, will be used to filter the models returned by the training dataset table name. Substring matching is supported. (e.g., "trainingTableName=table" will return both "table1" and "my_table").

parameters.name: dependent_variable
parameters.description: If specified, will be used to filter the models returned by the dependent variable column name. Substring matching is supported. (e.g., "dependentVariable=predictor" will return both "predictor" and "my predictor").

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: If specified, returns models with one of these statuses. It accepts a comma-separated list, possible values are 'running', 'failed', 'succeeded', 'idle', 'scheduled'.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: If specified, return items from any of these authors. It accepts a comma-separated list of user IDs.

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: If specified to be true, returns hidden items. Defaults to false, returning non-hidden items.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: The archival status of the requested item(s).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to its maximum of 50.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to updated_at. Must be one of: updated_at, name, created_at, last_run.updated_at.

parameters.name: order_dir

get.summary: List Notebooks

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: If specified to be true, returns hidden items. Defaults to false, returning non-hidden items.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: The archival status of the requested item(s).

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: If specified, return items from any of these authors. It accepts a comma-separated list of user IDs.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: If specified, returns notebooks with one of these statuses. It accepts a comma-separated list, possible values are 'running', 'pending', 'idle'.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 20. Maximum allowed is 50.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to updated_at. Must be one of: updated_at, name, created_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

get.summary: List projects

parameters.name: permission
parameters.description: A permissions string, one of "read", "write", or "manage". Lists only projects for which the current user has that permission.

parameters.name: auto_share
parameters.description: Used to filter projects based on whether the project is autoshare enabled or not.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: If specified, return items from any of these authors. It accepts a comma-separated list of user IDs.

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: If specified to be true, returns hidden items. Defaults to false, returning non-hidden items.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: The archival status of the requested item(s).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 20. Maximum allowed is 1000.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to updated_at. Must be one of: updated_at, name, created_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

get.summary: List queries

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Space delimited query for searching queries by their SQL. Supports wild card characters "?" for any single character, and "*" for zero or more characters.

parameters.name: database_id
parameters.description: The database ID.

parameters.name: credential_id
parameters.description: The credential ID.

parameters.name: author_id
parameters.description: The author of the query.

parameters.name: created_before
parameters.description: An upper bound for the creation date of the query.

parameters.name: created_after
parameters.description: A lower bound for the creation date of the query.

parameters.name: started_before
parameters.description: An upper bound for the start date of the last run.

parameters.name: started_after
parameters.description: A lower bound for the start date of the last run.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The state of the last run. One or more of queued, running, succeeded, failed, and cancelled. Specify multiple values as a comma-separated list (e.g., "A,B").

parameters.name: exclude_results
parameters.description: If true, does not return cached query results.

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: If specified to be true, returns hidden items. Defaults to false, returning non-hidden items.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: The archival status of the requested item(s).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 20. Maximum allowed is 50.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to created_at. Must be one of: created_at, started_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

get.summary: List Roles

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 50. Maximum allowed is 1000.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to id. Must be one of: id.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to asc.

get.summary: List Scripts

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: If specified, return items of these types. The valid types are sql, python3, javascript, r, containers, and dbt.

parameters.name: category
parameters.description: A job category for filtering scripts. Must be one of script, import, export, and enhancement.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: If specified, return items from any of these authors. It accepts a comma-separated list of user IDs.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: If specified, returns items with one of these statuses. It accepts a comma-separated list, possible values are 'running', 'failed', 'succeeded', 'idle', 'scheduled'.

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: If specified to be true, returns hidden items. Defaults to false, returning non-hidden items.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: The archival status of the requested item(s).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 20. Maximum allowed is 50.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to updated_at. Must be one of: updated_at, name, created_at, last_run.updated_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

get.summary: List Custom Scripts

parameters.name: from_template_id
parameters.description: If specified, return scripts based on the template with this ID. Specify multiple IDs as a comma-separated list.

parameters.name: author
parameters.description: If specified, return items from any of these authors. It accepts a comma-separated list of user IDs.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: If specified, returns items with one of these statuses. It accepts a comma-separated list, possible values are 'running', 'failed', 'succeeded', 'idle', 'scheduled'.

parameters.name: hidden
parameters.description: If specified to be true, returns hidden items. Defaults to false, returning non-hidden items.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: The archival status of the requested item(s).

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to its maximum of 50.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to updated_at. Must be one of: updated_at, name, created_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to asc.

get.summary: Search queries that are not hidden

parameters.name: search_string
parameters.description: Space delimited search terms for searching queries by their SQL. Supports wild card characters "?" for any single character, and "*" for zero or more characters.

parameters.name: database_id
parameters.description: The database ID.

parameters.name: credential_id
parameters.description: The credential ID.

parameters.name: author_id
parameters.description: The author of the query.

parameters.name: archived
parameters.description: The archival status of the requested item(s). Defaults to false.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: The state of the last run. One or more of queued, running, succeeded, failed, and cancelled.

parameters.name: started_before
parameters.description: An upper bound for the start date of the last run.

parameters.name: started_after
parameters.description: A lower bound for the start date of the last run.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 10. Maximum allowed is 50.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to last_run_started_at. Must be one of: last_run_started_at.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to desc.

post.summary: Creates and enqueues a single table scanner job on a new table

parameters.name: databaseId
parameters.description: The ID of the database.

parameters.name: schema
parameters.description: The name of the schema containing the table.

parameters.name: tableName
parameters.description: The name of the table.

parameters.name: statsPriority
parameters.description: When to sync table statistics. Valid Options are the following. Option: 'flag' means to flag stats for the next scheduled run of a full table scan on the database. Option: 'block' means to block this job on stats syncing. Option: 'queue' means to queue a separate job for syncing stats and do not block this job on the queued job. Defaults to 'flag'

get.summary: List tables

parameters.name: database_id
parameters.description: The ID of the database.

parameters.name: schema
parameters.description: If specified, will be used to filter the tables returned. Substring matching is supported with "%" and "*" wildcards (e.g., "schema=%census%" will return both "client_census.table" and "census_2010.table").

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: If specified, will be used to filter the tables returned. Substring matching is supported with "%" and "*" wildcards (e.g., "name=%table%" will return both "table1" and "my table").

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: If specified, will be used to filter the tables returned. Will search across schema and name (in the full form schema.name) and will return any full name containing the search string.

parameters.name: table_tag_ids
parameters.description: If specified, will be used to filter the tables returned. Will search across Table Tags and will return any tables that have one of the matching Table Tags.

parameters.name: credential_id
parameters.description: If specified, will be used instead of the default credential to filter the tables returned.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to return. Defaults to 50. Maximum allowed is 1000.

parameters.name: page_num
parameters.description: Page number of the results to return. Defaults to the first page, 1.

parameters.name: order
parameters.description: The field on which to order the result set. Defaults to schema. Must be one of: schema, name, search, table_tag_ids, credential_id.

parameters.name: order_dir
parameters.description: Direction in which to sort, either asc (ascending) or desc (descending) defaulting to asc.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description:

schedule.description: The schedule of when this enhancement will be run.

notifications.description: The notifications to send after the enhancement is run.

inputFieldMapping.description: The field (i.e., column) mapping for the input table. See https://api.civisanalytics.com/enhancements/field-mapping for a list of valid field types and descriptions. Each field type should be mapped to a string specifying a column name in the input table. For field types that support multiple values (e.g., the "phone" field), a list of column names can be provided (e.g., {"phone": ["home_phone", "mobile_phone"], ...}).

matchTargetId.description: The ID of the Civis Data match target. See /match_targets for IDs.

maxMatches.description: The maximum number of matches per record in the input table to return. Must be between 0 and 10. 0 returns all matches.

threshold.description: The score threshold (between 0 and 1). Matches below this threshold will not be returned. The default value is 0.5.

archived.description: Whether the Civis Data Match Job has been archived.

parentId.description: Parent ID that triggers this enhancement.

scheduledDays.description: Days of the week, based on numeric value starting at 0 for Sunday. Mutually exclusive with scheduledDaysOfMonth

scheduledHours.description: Hours of the day it is scheduled on.

scheduledMinutes.description: Minutes of the day it is scheduled on.

scheduledRunsPerHour.description: Deprecated in favor of scheduled minutes.

scheduledDaysOfMonth.description: Days of the month it is scheduled on, mutually exclusive with scheduledDays.

urls.description: URLs to receive a POST request at job completion

successEmailSubject.description: Custom subject line for success e-mail.

successEmailBody.description: Custom body text for success e-mail, written in Markdown.

successEmailAddresses.description: Addresses to notify by e-mail when the job completes successfully.

successEmailFromName.description: Name from which success emails are sent; defaults to "Civis."

successEmailReplyTo.description: Address for replies to success emails; defaults to the author of the job.

failureEmailAddresses.description: Addresses to notify by e-mail when the job fails.

stallWarningMinutes.description: Stall warning emails will be sent after this amount of minutes.

successOn.description: If success email notifications are on. Defaults to user's preferences.

failureOn.description: If failure email notifications are on. Defaults to user's preferences.

state.description: The state of the run, one of 'queued', 'running' or 'cancelled'.

objectType.description: The type of the output. Valid values are File, Table, Report, Project, Credential, or JSONValue

link.description: The hypermedia link to the output.

userIds.description: An array of one or more user IDs.

shareEmailBody.description: Custom body text for e-mail sent on a share.

sendSharedEmail.description: Send email to the recipients of a share.

groupIds.description: An array of one or more group IDs.

includeDependencies.description: Whether or not to give manage permissions on all dependencies

emailBody.description: Custom body text for e-mail sent on transfer.

sendEmail.description: Send email to the target user of the transfer?

status.description: The desired archived status of the object.

name.description: A user-specified name for the source.

numRecords.description: The number of input records for this run.

uniqueIds.description: The number of distinct unique IDs in the input records for this run.

uniqueDeduplicatedIds.description: The number of resolved IDs associated with more than one unique ID in the input.

maxClusterSize.description: The number of records in the largest cluster of resolved IDs.

avgClusterSize.description: The average number of records with the same resolved ID.

clusterSizeFrequencies.description: A mapping from numbers of records with the same resolved ID (i.e., sizes of clusters) to numbers of such clusters. For example, if there were 10 clusters with 2 records each, 2 would be a key in the mapping, and 10 would be its value.

startedAt.description: The time that the run started.

finishedAt.description: The time that the run completed.

error.description: The error message for this run, if present.

sampleRecordsQuery.description: A SQL query to produce a sample of records to inspect.

expandClusterQuery.description: A customizable query to view PII associated with resolved ids.

runMetrics.description: Metrics from this run of the Identity Resolution job.

schemaName.description: The name of the source schema.

tableName.description: The name of the source table.

fieldMapping.description: A mapping of PII fields to columns in this table. Valid keys are primary_key, first_name, middle_name, last_name, gender, phone, email, birth_date, birth_year, birth_month, birth_day, house_number, street, unit, full_address, city, state, state_code, zip, lat, lon, and name_suffix

source1.description: Name of the first source. Must be defined in Sources list.

source1JoinCol.description: Column from the first source to join on.

source2.description: Name of the second source. Must be defined in Sources list

source2JoinCol.description: Column from the second source to join on.

databaseName.description: The name of the destination database.

schemaName.description: The name of the destination schema.

tableName.description: The name of the destination table.

ranking.description: How preferred this source is for the given field. Rankings are zero-indexed and lower rank values are preferred to higher ones.

fieldName.description: The name of the field. Must be one of: first_name, middle_name, last_name, name_suffix, email, phone, birth_month, birth_day, birth_year, gender, address, house_number, street, unit, city, state_code, and zip.

ruleType.description: One of ["automatic", "preferred_source"]. Determines how the system will choose the value for a record. "automatic" will use the most frequent well-formatted value. "preferred_source" allows the user to prioritize values from particular sources over others.

sourcePreferences.description: Rank order for sources, when rule_type is "preferred_source".

threshold.description: A value that determines the extent to which similar records get assigned the same resolved ID. Must be within 0.5 and 1, inclusive. Defaults to 0.8 if unspecified.Higher values may result in fewer cases where records about different individuals erroneously receive the same resolved ID, but also more more cases where records about the same individual receive different resolved IDs.

enforcedLinks.description: A specification of related columns in different sources. The IDR tool will ensure that records with the same values in the specified columns receive the same Resolved ID.

goldenTable.description: Definition of the destination table for Golden Table information. Requires Customer Graph to be generated.

performNcoa.description: Whether to update addresses for records matching the National Change of Address (NCOA) database.

ncoaCredentialId.description: Credential to use when performing NCOA updates. Required if 'performNcoa' is true.

batchSize.description: The maximum number of records processed at a time. Note that this parameter is not available to all users.

existingFiles.description: Notifies the job of what to do in the case that the exported file already exists at the provided path.One of: fail, append, overwrite. Default: fail. If "append" is specified,the new file will always be added to the provided path. If "overwrite" is specifiedall existing files at the provided path will be deleted and the new file will be added.By default, or if "fail" is specified, the export will fail if a file exists at the provided path.

filenamePrefix.description: The prefix of the name of the file returned to the user.

name.description: The name of this Csv Export job.

includeHeader.description: A boolean value indicating whether or not the header should be included. Defaults to true.

compression.description: The compression of the output file. Valid arguments are "gzip" and "none". Defaults to "gzip".

columnDelimiter.description: The column delimiter for the output file. Valid arguments are "comma", "tab", and "pipe". Defaults to "comma".

hidden.description: A boolean value indicating whether or not this request should be hidden. Defaults to false.

forceMultifile.description: Whether or not the csv should be split into multiple files. Default: false

maxFileSize.description: The max file size, in MB, created files will be. Only available when force_multifile is true.

additionalCredentials.description: Array that holds additional credentials used for specific imports. For DB Syncs, the first element is an SSL private key credential id, and the second element is the corresponding public key credential id.

schema.description: The database schema name.

useWithoutSchema.description: This attribute is no longer available; defaults to false but cannot be used.

id.description: The ID of the table or file, if available.

path.description: The path of the dataset to sync from; for a database source, schema.tablename. If you are doing a Google Sheet export, this can be blank. This is a legacy parameter, it is recommended you use one of the following: databaseTable, file, googleWorksheet

databaseTable.description: The sync source is a database table.

file.description: The sync source is a file.

googleWorksheet.description: The sync source is a Google worksheet.

salesforce.description: The sync source is Salesforce. Deprecated. Please use the new version instead, see https://support.civisanalytics.com/hc/en-us/articles/8774034069261-Salesforce-Import for details.

path.description: The schema.tablename to sync to. If you are doing a Google Sheet export, this is the spreadsheet and sheet name separated by a period. i.e. if you have a spreadsheet named "MySpreadsheet" and a sheet called "Sheet1" this field would be "MySpreadsheet.Sheet1". This is a legacy parameter, it is recommended you use one of the following: databaseTable, googleWorksheet

databaseTable.description: The sync destination is a database table.

googleWorksheet.description: The sync destination is a Google worksheet.

name.description: The column name that will override the auto-detected name.

type.description: Declaration of SQL type that will override the auto-detected SQL type, including necessary properties such as length, precision, etc.

maxErrors.description: For Google Doc and Auto Imports. The maximum number of errors that can occur without the job failing.

existingTableRows.description: For Google Doc and Auto Imports. The behavior if a table with the requested name already exists.  One of "fail", "truncate", "append", or "drop". Defaults to "fail".

firstRowIsHeader.description: For Google Doc and Auto Imports. A boolean value indicating whether or not the first row is a header row.

diststyle.description: For Auto Imports. The diststyle to use for a Redshift table.

distkey.description: For Auto Imports. The distkey to use for a Redshift table.

sortkey1.description: For Auto Imports. The first sortkey to use for a Redshift table.

sortkey2.description: For Auto Imports. The second sortkey to use for a Redshift table.

columnDelimiter.description: For Auto Imports. The column delimiter for the file. Valid arguments are "comma", "tab", and "pipe". If column_delimiter is null or omitted, it will be auto-detected.

columnOverrides.description: For Auto Imports. Hash used for overriding auto-detected names and types, with keys being the index of the column being overridden.

escaped.description: For Auto Imports. If true, escape quotes with a backslash; otherwise, escape quotes by double-quoting. Defaults to false.

identityColumn.description: For DB Syncs. The column or columns to use as primary key for incremental syncs. Should be a unique identifier. If blank, primary key columns will be auto-detected. If more than one identity column is specified, an identity column must be specified for each table. We recommend the primary key be a sequential data type such as an integer, double, timestamp, date, or float. If using a primary key that is a string data type, we recommend having a last_modified_column to ensure all data is synced to the destination table.

lastModifiedColumn.description: For DB Syncs. The column to use to detect recently modified data for incremental syncs. Defaults to "Auto-Detect", which will use the first column it finds containing either "modif" or "update" in the name. When specified, only rows where last_modified_column in the source >= last_modified_column in the destination will be synced.

rowChunkSize.description: For DB Syncs. If specified, will split the sync into chunks of this size.

wipeDestinationTable.description: For DB Syncs. If true, will perform a full table refresh.

truncateLongLines.description: For DB Syncs to Redshift. When true, truncates column data to fit the column specification.

invalidCharReplacement.description: For DB Syncs to Redshift. If specified, will replace each invalid UTF-8 character with this character. Must be a single ASCII character.

verifyTableRowCounts.description: For DB Syncs. When true, an error will be raised if the destination table does not have the same number of rows as the source table after the sync.

mysqlCatalogMatchesSchema.description: This attribute is no longer available; defaults to true but cannot be used.

exportAction.description: For Google Doc Exports. The kind of export action you want to have the export execute. Set to "newsprsht" if you want a new worksheet inside a new spreadsheet. Set to "newwksht" if you want a new worksheet inside an existing spreadsheet. Set to "updatewksht" if you want to overwrite an existing worksheet inside an existing spreadsheet. Set to "appendwksht" if you want to append to the end of an existing worksheet inside an existing spreadsheet. Default is set to "newsprsht"

sqlQuery.description: For Google Doc Exports. The SQL query for the export.

maxErrors.description: The maximum number of rows with errors to remove from the import before failing.

existingTableRows.description: The behaviour if a table with the requested name already exists.  One of "fail", "truncate", "append", or "drop".Defaults to "fail".

diststyle.description: The diststyle to use for the table. One of "even", "all", or "key".

distkey.description: The column to use as the distkey for the table.

sortkey2.description: The second column in a compound sortkey for the table.

columnDelimiter.description: The column delimiter of the file. If column_delimiter is null or omitted, it will be auto-detected. Valid arguments are "comma", "tab", and "pipe".

firstRowIsHeader.description: A boolean value indicating whether or not the first row is a header row. If first_row_is_header is null or omitted, it will be auto-detected.

multipart.description: If true, the upload URI will require a `multipart/form-data` POST request. Defaults to false.

escaped.description: If true, escape quotes with a backslash; otherwise, escape quotes by double-quoting. Defaults to false.

hidden.description: The hidden status of the item.

uploadUri.description: The URI which may be used to upload a tabular file for import. You must use this URI to upload the file you wish imported and then inform the Civis API when your upload is complete using the URI given by the runUri field of this response.

runUri.description: The URI to POST to once the file upload is complete. After uploading the file using the URI given in the uploadUri attribute of the response, POST to this URI to initiate the import of your uploaded file into the platform.

uploadFields.description: If multipart was set to true, these fields should be included in the multipart upload.

importId.description: The ID of the Import job.

state.description: The state of the run, one of 'queued' 'running' 'succeeded' 'failed' or 'cancelled'.

isCancelRequested.description: True if run cancel requested, else false.

createdAt.description: The time the run was created.

startedAt.description: The time the run started at.

finishedAt.description: The time the run completed.

error.description: The error, if any, returned by the run.

storageHostId.description: The ID of the source storage host.

credentialId.description: The ID of the credentials for the source storage host.

filePaths.description: The file or directory path(s) within the bucket from which to import.  E.g. the file_path for "s3://mybucket/files/all/" would be "/files/all/"If specifying a directory path, the job will import every file found under that path. All files must have the same column layout and file format (e.g., compression, columnDelimiter, etc.).

fileIds.description: The file ID(s) to import, if importing Civis file(s).

storagePath.description: The storage host file path to import, if importing files from an external storage provider (ex. S3).

schema.description: The destination schema name.

remoteHostId.description: The ID of the destination database host.

credentialId.description: The ID of the credentials for the destination database.

primaryKeys.description: A list of column(s) which together uniquely identify a row in the destination table.These columns must not contain NULL values. If the import mode is "upsert", this field is required;see the Civis Helpdesk article on "Advanced CSV Imports via the Civis API" for more information.

lastModifiedKeys.description: A list of the columns indicating a record has been updated.If the destination table does not exist, and the import mode is "upsert", this field is required.

sqlType.description: The SQL type of the column.

diststyle.description: The diststyle to use for the table. One of "even", "all", or "key".

distkey.description: Distkey for this table in Redshift

sortkeys.description: Sortkeys for this table in Redshift. Please provide a maximum of two.

source.description: The source file(s). Provide either an array of Civis file_ids or a storage path hash with an array of one or more file_paths.

firstRowIsHeader.description: A boolean value indicating whether or not the first row of the source file is a header row.

columnDelimiter.description: The column delimiter for the file. Valid arguments are "comma", "tab", and "pipe". Defaults to "comma".

escaped.description: A boolean value indicating whether or not the source file has quotes escaped with a backslash.Defaults to false.

compression.description: The type of compression of the source file. Valid arguments are "gzip" and "none". Defaults to "none".

existingTableRows.description: The behavior if a destination table with the requested name already exists.  One of "fail", "truncate", "append", "drop", or "upsert".Defaults to "fail".

maxErrors.description: The maximum number of rows with errors to ignore before failing. This option is not supported for Postgres databases.

tableColumns.description: An array of hashes corresponding to the columns in the order they appear in the source file. Each hash should have keys for database column "name" and "sqlType".This parameter is required if the table does not exist, the table is being dropped, or the columns in the source file do not appear in the same order as in the destination table.The "sqlType" key is not required when appending to an existing table.

loosenTypes.description: If true, SQL types with precisions/lengths will have these values increased to accommodate data growth in future loads. Type loosening only occurs on table creation. Defaults to false.

execution.description: In upsert mode, controls the movement of data in upsert mode. If set to "delayed", the data will be moved after a brief delay. If set to "immediate", the data will be moved immediately. In non-upsert modes, controls the speed at which detailed column stats appear in the data catalogue. Defaults to "delayed", to accommodate concurrent upserts to the same table and speedier non-upsert imports.

redshiftDestinationOptions.description: Additional options for imports whose destination is a Redshift table.

file.description: The sync source is a file.

googleWorksheet.description: The sync source is a Google worksheet.

salesforce.description: The sync source is Salesforce. Deprecated. Please use the new version instead, see https://support.civisanalytics.com/hc/en-us/articles/8774034069261-Salesforce-Import for details.

path.description: The schema.tablename to sync to. If you are doing a Google Sheet export, this is the spreadsheet and sheet name separated by a period. i.e. if you have a spreadsheet named "MySpreadsheet" and a sheet called "Sheet1" this field would be "MySpreadsheet.Sheet1". This is a legacy parameter, it is recommended you use one of the following: databaseTable, googleWorksheet

databaseTable.description: The sync destination is a database table.

googleWorksheet.description: The sync destination is a Google worksheet.

name.description: The column name that will override the auto-detected name.

type.description: Declaration of SQL type that will override the auto-detected SQL type, including necessary properties such as length, precision, etc.

maxErrors.description: For Google Doc and Auto Imports. The maximum number of errors that can occur without the job failing.

existingTableRows.description: For Google Doc and Auto Imports. The behavior if a table with the requested name already exists.  One of "fail", "truncate", "append", or "drop". Defaults to "fail".

firstRowIsHeader.description: For Google Doc and Auto Imports. A boolean value indicating whether or not the first row is a header row.

diststyle.description: For Auto Imports. The diststyle to use for a Redshift table.

distkey.description: For Auto Imports. The distkey to use for a Redshift table.

sortkey1.description: For Auto Imports. The first sortkey to use for a Redshift table.

sortkey2.description: For Auto Imports. The second sortkey to use for a Redshift table.

columnDelimiter.description: For Auto Imports. The column delimiter for the file. Valid arguments are "comma", "tab", and "pipe". If column_delimiter is null or omitted, it will be auto-detected.

columnOverrides.description: For Auto Imports. Hash used for overriding auto-detected names and types, with keys being the index of the column being overridden.

escaped.description: For Auto Imports. If true, escape quotes with a backslash; otherwise, escape quotes by double-quoting. Defaults to false.

identityColumn.description: For DB Syncs. The column or columns to use as primary key for incremental syncs. Should be a unique identifier. If blank, primary key columns will be auto-detected. If more than one identity column is specified, an identity column must be specified for each table. We recommend the primary key be a sequential data type such as an integer, double, timestamp, date, or float. If using a primary key that is a string data type, we recommend having a last_modified_column to ensure all data is synced to the destination table.

lastModifiedColumn.description: For DB Syncs. The column to use to detect recently modified data for incremental syncs. Defaults to "Auto-Detect", which will use the first column it finds containing either "modif" or "update" in the name. When specified, only rows where last_modified_column in the source >= last_modified_column in the destination will be synced.

rowChunkSize.description: For DB Syncs. If specified, will split the sync into chunks of this size.

wipeDestinationTable.description: For DB Syncs. If true, will perform a full table refresh.

truncateLongLines.description: For DB Syncs to Redshift. When true, truncates column data to fit the column specification.

invalidCharReplacement.description: For DB Syncs to Redshift. If specified, will replace each invalid UTF-8 character with this character. Must be a single ASCII character.

verifyTableRowCounts.description: For DB Syncs. When true, an error will be raised if the destination table does not have the same number of rows as the source table after the sync.

mysqlCatalogMatchesSchema.description: This attribute is no longer available; defaults to true but cannot be used.

exportAction.description: For Google Doc Exports. The kind of export action you want to have the export execute. Set to "newsprsht" if you want a new worksheet inside a new spreadsheet. Set to "newwksht" if you want a new worksheet inside an existing spreadsheet. Set to "updatewksht" if you want to overwrite an existing worksheet inside an existing spreadsheet. Set to "appendwksht" if you want to append to the end of an existing worksheet inside an existing spreadsheet. Default is set to "newsprsht"

sqlQuery.description: For Google Doc Exports. The SQL query for the export.

schedule.description: The schedule of when this script will be run.

notifications.description: The notifications to send after the script is run.

requiredResources.description: Resources to allocate for the container.

repoHttpUri.description: The location of a github repo to clone into the container, e.g. github.com/my-user/my-repo.git.

repoRef.description: The tag or branch of the github repo to clone into the container.

remoteHostCredentialId.description: The id of the database credentials to pass into the environment of the container.

gitCredentialId.description: The id of the git credential to be used when checking out the specified git repo. If not supplied, the first git credential you've submitted will be used. Unnecessary if no git repo is specified or the git repo is public.

dockerCommand.description: The command to run on the container. Will be run via sh as: ["sh", "-c", dockerCommand]. Defaults to the Docker image's ENTRYPOINT/CMD.

dockerImageName.description: The name of the docker image to pull from DockerHub.

dockerImageTag.description: The tag of the docker image to pull from DockerHub.

instanceType.description: The EC2 instance type to deploy to. Only available for jobs running on kubernetes.

cancelTimeout.description: The amount of time (in seconds) to wait before forcibly terminating the script. When the script is cancelled, it is first sent a TERM signal. If the script is still running after the timeout, it is sent a KILL signal. Defaults to 0.

timeZone.description: The time zone of this script.

partitionLabel.description: The partition label used to run this object.

targetProjectId.description: Target project to which script outputs will be added.

runningAsId.description: The ID of the runner of this script.

level.description: The log level of this message [default: info]

createdAt.description: The timestamp of this message in ISO 8601 format. This is what logs are ordered by, so it is recommended to use timestamps with nanosecond precision. If absent, defaults to the time that the log was received by the API.

level.description: The log level of this message [default: info]

messages.description: If specified, a batch of logs to store. If createdAt timestamps for the logs are supplied, the ordering of this list is not preserved, and the timestamps are used to sort the logs.If createdAt timestamps are not supplied, the ordering of this list is preserved and the logs are given the timestamp of when they were received.

childJobId.description: The ID of the child job the message came from.

type.description: The type of the script (e.g SQL, Container, Python, R, JavaScript, dbt)

createdAt.description: The time this script was created.

updatedAt.description: The time the script was last updated.

state.description: The status of the script's last run.

finishedAt.description: The time that the script's last run finished.

projects.description: A list of projects containing the script.

parentId.description: The ID of the parent job that will trigger this script

isTemplate.description: Whether others scripts use this one as a template.

fromTemplateId.description: The ID of the template this script uses, if any.

timeZone.description: The time zone of this script.

lastRun.description: The last run of this script.

archived.description: The archival status of the requested item(s).

templateScriptId.description: The ID of the template script, if any.

includeHeader.description: Whether or not to include headers in the output data. Default: true

compression.description: The type of compression to use, if any, one of "none", "zip", or "gzip". Default: gzip

columnDelimiter.description: Which delimiter to use, one of "comma", "tab", or "pipe". Default: comma

unquoted.description: Whether or not to quote fields. Default: false

forceMultifile.description: Whether or not the csv should be split into multiple files. Default: false

filenamePrefix.description: A user specified filename prefix for the output file to have. Default: null

maxFileSize.description: The max file size, in MB, created files will be. Only available when force_multifile is true.
